programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Durham, N.C. to meet with the biggest name in the sport of lacrosse: Duke attackman Brennan O'Neill. The No. 1 pick in the 2024 PLL Draft already has a Tewaaraton Award and an MVP of Team USA under his belt. This episode of THROUGH X will dive into his mindset and discover what's driving him in his final year on campus. Paul Carcaterra also visits South Bend, Indiana to learn from one of the best brother-duos in the history of lacrosse.

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don shows which plants to choose for sensational borders right through the summer - from ornamental grasses to late flowering perennials. He also plants out squashes and pumpkins, as well as making his own comfrey feed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage giving advice on the best hardy geraniums for different situations and sharing tips on how to lift, divide and propagate them.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This show celebrates the arrival of the holiday season. At Longmeadow, Monty ensures that there will be late summer colour by propagating some his favourites from the fantastically diverse salvia family. He also divides irises and reveals what has gone wrong with his onion crop. Joe finds seasonal inspiration at historic Newby Hall in North Yorkshire, home to the longest herbaceous borders in Europe.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Toby Buckland visits the RHS garden at Hyde Hall in Essex for ideas on creating and planting a dry garden, while Carol Klein shows her gardening students how to collect seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don unveils his plans for a wet meadow. He starts by planting herbaceous perennials that will thrive in heavy soils and also look good amidst the long grass. He also pots-on his salvia cuttings and explains the benefits of planting `green manure' in the veg patch. Now that he has harvested his potatoes, that is exactly what he is doing to boost the fertility of the soil for next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with all his summer jobs in the border and the vegetable garden. Carol gets inspiration for planting combinations at Cothay Manor and Gardens, and Arit learns about slugs and snails.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dodge Charger and a field full of project cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hunts for barn finds in Midland, TX, where he finds a 1972 Dodge Charger for sale. Tom then gets the stories behind a yard full of old project cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on the iconic St. Johns River. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: What is Southern Culture on the Fly? Jay links up with the founders of this grassroots angling staple - SCOF Magazine.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Watch along as Jay learns to clean fish from ‪@reedthefishmonger‬. Watch the full video and learn to clean any fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at the seine net to catch some shrimp. Then meets up with Chef Dave to cook up some amazing Shrimp and Grits. After, Travel to Jekyll Island for the Shrimp and Grits Festival.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John meets with the experts at Marine Surplus to select proper fiberglass materials for his classic 200 Aquasport project, then back at SSTV HQ, John and Bert tackle raising the transom to 25”.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John and Bert work to gut and re-foam the stingers in the classic 200 Aquasport project. John visits the experts at Marine Surplus to search for a new center console. Finally, we learn about new carpeting options on the classic Glastron project and get expert marine hardware tips.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are smacking turkeys and making mid-term investments. 1031 Tax money is the number one way to build your land portfolio and create a place for your family to enjoy. Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting camp—each with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John meets with the experts at Marine Surplus to select proper fiberglass materials for his classic 200 Aquasport project, then back at SSTV HQ, John and Bert tackle raising the transom to 25”.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John and Bert work to gut and re-foam the stingers in the classic 200 Aquasport project. John visits the experts at Marine Surplus to search for a new center console. Finally, we learn about new carpeting options on the classic Glastron project and get expert marine hardware tips.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are smacking turkeys and making mid-term investments. 1031 Tax money is the number one way to build your land portfolio and create a place for your family to enjoy. Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.desc: The life of an arrogant pseudo-intellectual living at home in Texas with his angelic mom is threatened when she falls in love with a self-help guru.

programme.title: Mr. Nice Guy
programme.desc: A TV chef’s fighting skills are put to the test when he is pursued by ruthless drug dealers who are convinced he possesses an incriminating videotape.

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Two sanitation workers and diehard wrestling fans watch their idol suffer a career-ending defeat and travel to Atlanta to mastermind his comeback.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew in WWII must contend with thirsty Nazi troops while crossing the Sahara in search of a fabled water well.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wife’s divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: My Mom's New Boyfriend
programme.desc: An FBI agent discovers more than he wanted to about his mom when he is ordered to spy on her new boyfriend, a suspect in an art theft investigation.

programme.title: I Dreamed of Africa
programme.desc: A bored Italian socialite abandons her jet-set lifestyle for the rigors and rewards of rural Kenya in this true story based on a best-selling memoir.

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: A young public relations exec goes on a remarkably disastrous blind date that threatens to upend his entire life while opening him up to true love.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: The Broken Hearts Club: A Romantic Comedy
programme.desc: A group of gay friends in Los Angeles share the ups and downs of relationships, careers, fatherhood, the deaths of friends, and new beginnings.

programme.title: To Write Love on Her Arms
programme.desc: Based on the life of Renee Yohe, who battled drugs, depression, and issues, that led to the founding of the charity group To Write Love on Her Arms.

programme.title: Raising Waylon
programme.desc: A restaurateur (Thomas Gibson) and a photographer (Poppy Montgomery) learn surprising things about themselves while taking care of their 9-year-old godchild.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: A young ad executive facing terminal cancer and expecting a child records his life's journey, confronting his past for his unborn child's future.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: Phffft!
programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. They’re dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.title: Salomé (1953)
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fiancée, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: A fearless sailor returns to the kingdom of Thessaly after a 20-year voyage to find the Golden Fleece and make his rightful claim to the throne.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: Renegades
programme.desc: Hannah Brockway (Evelyn Keyes) has a perfect fiancé in Dr. Sam Martin (Willard Parker). Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: The Last Rebel
programme.desc: Two Confederates (Joe Namath, Jack Elam) save a man's (Woody Strode) life and cause trouble in 1865 Missouri.

programme.title: Ridin' for Justice
programme.desc: A popular cowboy (Buck Jones) takes the blame for the death of a deputy who tried to force himself on the marshal's wife.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: North From the Lone Star
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) puts on a badge to clean up a town.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The Great Race
programme.desc: Set in 1908, dastardly, black-garbed Professor Fate dares the world's greatest hero, The Great Leslie, to race 22,000 miles from New York to Paris.

programme.title: The Americanization of Emily
programme.desc: A black comedy about honor, cowardice and unexpected heroism.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Bowery Bombshell
programme.desc: When one of the Bowery Boys is photographed in front of a bank during a robbery, he becomes a suspect.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Jinx Money
programme.desc: After the Bowery Boys find a dead gambler's money, they're soon pursued by the mob and police.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Live Wires
programme.desc: In the first Bowery Boys film, the boys take on gangsters from a construction company.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: News Hounds
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys become undercover newspaper journalists and investigate a ring of gamblers.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: In Fast Company
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys get into the taxicab business and fight a conniving rival cab company.

programme.desc: The Bowery Boys accidentally become private detectives, and their investigation uncovers a fraudulent psychic.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Angels in Disguise
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys go undercover to catch some unruly gangsters.

programme.desc: After one of the Bowery Boys inherits an estate on Long Island, the crew face a German gang of smugglers.

programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: The Tunnel of Love
programme.desc: A married couple endures endless red tape when they try to adopt a child.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a woman is swallowed whole by a giant snake, the CSI team suspects that Horatio's nemesis, Clavo Cruz, is behind an operation that uses snakes to smuggle drugs into the country.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team race against time to find a killer who escaped from prison while helping to fight a fire in the Everglades; a local college student is found shot, but the blaze has destroyed the crime scene and evidence.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team must find the person who caused a jet carrying $1.2 billion in checks to crash in a suburban neighborhood.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the possible murder of Jake Sullivan (Tony Hawk), a skateboarder and video-game tester.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When an IRS agent is killed trying to repossess a yacht, and another is shot to death soon afterward, the team searches for the perpetrators in a potential series of murders before tax day.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio gets life changing information about his deceased brother.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a bitter custody battle ends with a courthouse murder, the team must use the available evidence to find the killer.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When there is a murder at a high-school reunion, the team investigates and learns that popularity issues from the past played a role in the killer's motives.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a condemned ax-murderer on death row appeals for his life, the team must investigate.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Riley disappears during her first solo mission; Mac and the team attempt to locate her.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver and the team must steal diamonds before terrorists beat them to it and trade the jewels for a weapon of mass destruction.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Murdoc drugs and kidnaps MacGyver, Mac must escape and join the team to save Murdoc's next victim.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The team's Halloween plans are interrupted when the vice president's son's plane goes down with a mysterious prisoner on board.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team attempt to extinguish a massive oil wellhead fire set by a rebel group in Nigeria.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver uses a heater and hot sauce to help a key presidential candidate in Ecuador receive a heart transplant he desperately needs after a rebel group tries to sabotage delivery of the organ.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver and Jack "steal" a priceless painting to draw out an infamous stolen art dealer; Riley's estranged father asks to be part of her life; Matty sends Bozer to a spy training camp.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team follow mercenaries who are transporting stolen lethal nerve gas; Jack confronts Elwood about Riley; Bozer is pushed to his limit in spy school.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a serial killer along the Appalachian Trail in rural Virginia.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates the case of two murdered families, where two high school students are the sole survivors.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Three children vanish while riding their bikes on the same path where a similar unsolved disappearance took place 30 years earlier.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A man who believes himself to be the brother of Dr. Tara Lewis arrives in town, knowing everything about Tara's family; Tara is unable to make contact with her real brother.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team investigates when the remains of a dozen people are discovered along a creek bed in Yakima, Wash.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: While conducting a profiling course on his birthday, Rossi gets a call from serial killer Tommy Yates, who gives him the location of his latest victim.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates when home invasions involving casualties strike upscale neighborhoods in San Diego.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates when a bizarre hieroglyph is found under a deceased homeless man's armpit; Reid decides to take his mother out of a clinical study early to bring her home.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team is called in to investigate when male bodies are discovered that seem to be impossible to identify.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a BAU member gets in trouble in Mexico, the team enlists the services of the International Response Team for help.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A big heart can be a problem for a bail bondsman and today's hunt is a case in point. Dog gave a break to a young man with a drug problem who promised to enter drug rehab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that looks can be deceiving and today's hunt makes this point crystal clear. The fugitive is pretty, petite, and trouble. She stands accused of settling an argument with the help of a box cutter.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When can a bounty hunt also be a date? When Dog and Beth decide to ride in the same SUV as they pursue a run away fugitive, will their different approaches to the investigation lead to a capture and romance?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have to be at the state capitol bright and early to receive an award for their fight against ice in Hawaii. Afterwards, they're inspired to start the hunt for Shanna, an alleged ice user and identity thief with $80,000 in bonds.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog and the Posse for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kristine had a string of gambling and forgery charges before she jumped bail leaving Dog "holding the bag" -- in this case a $20,000 bond. Now it's time for Dog to call in some chits of his own.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The day starts with Duane Lee and Leland facing off in the kind of court rarely associated with the Chapmans...a tennis court. At stake, as always, are bragging rights for which son can claim the title of "Chapman Champ."

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's hunt takes Dog far from the glittering hotels of Waikiki to the parts of Hawaii tourist rarely see, Oahu's ramshackle tent cities. The team searches for a woman who has lost almost everything, her home, her family and her spirit.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is up in the high plains of Colorado helping a fellow bondman bring his most elusive fugitives to justice. When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today was once an upstanding member of his community. Now with no home, no job and the law on his trail, this middle-aged exile from middle-class society is using the cold end of an ice pipe to soothe his troubled soul.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his posse head to Colorado for a special mission--to catch Marco, an alleged drug dealer. It's been ten months since Marco went on the lam, and his bondsman stands to lose his family business if Marco is not caught.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has two fugitives to catch, and he gets help from the unlikeliest sources--the fugitives' mothers. First, Ginger's mother wants to revoke her daughter's bond because 18-year-old Ginger is selling drugs and running wild.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: No one becomes a bondsman overnight and even the members of Dog's team know there is always more to learn. So when Duane Lee cuts a felon a little too much slack about checking-in and then goes missing, Duane Lee knows he's gonna get schooled.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today, Dog and the boys are going after a fugitive with a serious price tag. Tim failed to appear in court on a $25,000 bond and has a string of theft charges behind him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Only in Dog's world would a bantam fighting cock, a pregnant daughter, and a jungle safe house go together. And don't forget the mopeds as well a group of hostile squatters on government land! They're all part of the hunt for an elusive criminal.

programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call--The Dog! And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.
